result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Marcus Cortez Funches in court, in custody.  
Court to address competency evaluation prepared by Dr. Collins. (findings are defendant is not currently competent, but likely to regain within the statutory time frame)

State has recevied a copy of the evaluation and does not contest the evaluation.
Defendant remains silent.
Court finds the defendant is not currently competent, but likely to regain within the statutory time frame.
Court commits the defendant to DHS for purposes of treatment.
Court directs the public defender's office to appoint counsel for defendant.
Defendant is to be transported to either Mendota or Winnebago when a bed is available.
Court signs Order of Commitment for Treatment.
  Review hearing scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
filed by Dr. Collins
Review hearing on February 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:15 am Defendant in Court, in custody.  The Court notes the preliminary hearing was adjourned on Friday as Competency was raised but the Sheriff's Department had not received notice and produced the defendant today.  The Court conducts colloquy with the defendant in regards to counsel and being evaluated by the Public Defenders Office.  The defendant states he does not wish to have an attorney and will represent himself.  The Court notifies the defendant of his next date before the Trial Court.  Bail remains as fixed.
Proposed Competency Order

03:27 PM Defendant Marcus Cortez Funches in court, in custody, with attorney  State Public Defender Law Intern.   Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court goes over the procedural history of the case.
Mr. Longoria states that the Defendant has refused SPD representation.
The Court questions the Defendant as to what his wishes for representation are.
The Defendant does not give an audible answer.
ASSISTANT DISTRICT ATTORNEY REQUESTS ORDER FOR COMPETENCY PURSUANT TO SEC.. 971.14(2).  Court grants request and orders the defendant be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  To be done as an outpatient basis within 30 days.
The court cancels the prelim hearing set on January 24, 2022 and will find good cause to tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Review hearing scheduled for February 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on January 24, 2022 at 08:15 am.
